This is file contains the R code for the "Mathematics for Economics" preparation. I recreate plots, figure, diagramms for the sake of practicing. 

```{Figure 1}
# Load required package
install.packages("ggplot2")
library(ggplot2)

# Define the function
f <- function(x) (x - 1) * (3 - x)

# Create a data frame with a sequence of x values
df <- data.frame(x = seq(-5, 5, by = 0.01))
df$y <- f(df$x)

# Create a ggplot object
p <- ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed") +  # Add a horizontal line at y = 0
  geom_vline(xintercept = c(1, 3), linetype = "dashed", color = "red") +  # Add vertical lines at x = 1 and x = 3
  annotate("text", x = c(-3, 2, 5), y = f(c(-3, 2, 5)), label = c("-3", "2", "5"), vjust = -1) +  # Add labels for the given x values
  theme_minimal()

# Print the plot
print(p)
```
